3d90bd6e-4292-4c65-aaff-1cb93c02c551.content:
It‚Äôs a bloodbath this month for German new car sales, down -27.8% year-on-year in August to just 197,322. This mediocre result tilts the year-to-date tally into negative at -0.3% to 1,907,226. We are now -37% below the pre-pandemic August 2019 volume (313,748) and -24% below the 8 months 2019 result (2,495,536). Of note is the implosion of BEV sales off -68.8% year-on-year to 27,024 and 13.7% share vs. 86,649 and 31.7% share, admittedly helped by the year-ago rush to register EV before subsidies dry out. YTD BEV sales are down -32% to 241,911 and 12.7% share vs. 18.6% over the first 8 months of 2023.

Looking at the brands ranking, Volkswagen (-23.3%) holds 17.9% of the market vs. 19.2% so far this year, with Mercedes (-15.5%) and BMW (-23%) also containing their losses somewhat. Skoda (+0.03%) manages the impressive feat of staying stable year-on-year and overtakes Audi (-36.6%) ‚Äì hit particularly hard ‚Äì both for the month and year-to-date to #4. Seat (-10.1%), Toyota (-12.3%) and Opel (-17.1%) also resist but Ford (-28%) and Hyundai (-31.2%) fall fast. Volvo (+18.8%), Lexus (+17%), Peugeot (+16.9%) and Mitsubishi (+7.1%) are among the rare year-on-year gainers further down the charts. Tesla is off -65.7% and the Chinese carmakers freefall: MG is down -75.8%, GWM down -88.7% and BYD down -89.3%.

Model-wise, the VW T-Roc (-11.4%) threepeats at #1 with 2.9% share, still not enough to grab the YTD lead. Below the VW Tiguan (-1.3%) is up two spots on July to #2, the event of the month is the Opel Astra (+102.3%) more than doubling its sales year-on-year to overtake its (former) archenemy the VW Golf (-35.6%). According to our records, the last time the Astra outsold the Golf was in 1992 when the first generation Astra topped the charts from January to March. The Astra now ranks #5 year-to-date vs. #29 over the Full Year 2023. The Skoda Octavia (+19.7%) posts a stellar year-on-year increase to remain inside the Top 5. Excellent month as well for the VW Polo (+41.2%) up 11 ranks on last month to #6. We welcome the Alfa Romeo Junior at #234 and the Renault 5 at #269.
3d90bd6e-4292-4c65-aaff-1cb93c02c551.title: Germany August 2024: Market off -27.8%, BEVs down -68.8%, Opel Astra outsells VW Golf

457fb1d6-3822-415c-9a53-e91d8b2a106d.content:
de Minaur got to see Rafael Nadal close-up earlier this year when he played him in back-to-back tournaments on clay. One win and one defeat was a healthy return for the Australian on Nadal‚Äôs favourite surface, even if the 22-time grand slam champion was only making his way back from injury at the time. But as he continues to plot his way through the draw at the US Open, it is Nadal‚Äôs philosophy that is helping De Minaur impose himself on his opponents.

It  was back in 2012, when he was assessing Andy Murray‚Äôs defeat by Novak Djokovic in the semi-finals of the Australian Open, that Nadal gave an insight into the attitude that helped to make him such a formidable competitor. Murray had led Djokovic two sets to one, only to suffer a physical and mental dip in the fourth set. He recovered in the fifth but Djokovic held on to reach the final. Murray‚Äôs mistake was to let Djokovic get away just when he had the momentum himself.

"Winning two sets to one‚Ä¶ winning with 7‚Äë6, to win a tournament like this and to play against a player like Djokovic, you cannot start the fourth set like this,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the moment to play with more intensity than ever, not start with 3‚Äë0 down and two breaks in five minutes. That way you lose the match. You want to win the tournament, you cannot start ‚Äì you can lose, the other can beat you ‚Äì but you cannot lose in the beginning. When the other has more doubts, is in real trouble, you [can‚Äôt] make it easier than what should be, no?‚Äù
457fb1d6-3822-415c-9a53-e91d8b2a106d.title: Alex de Minaur channels his inner-Nadal to crank up intensity at US Open

47def2db-de13-46a4-9ab7-b1b654e0c8be.content:
New adventure, new rival, and an unexpected ally as Paramount Pictures releases the official trailer for their upcoming sequel film Sonic the Hedgehog 3. View trailer below.

Sonic, Tails, and Knuckles are pitted against a mysterious and powerful new adversary, Shadow the Hedgehog. The trio seeks out an unlikely alliance with Dr. Robotnik in hopes of stopping Shadow and protecting the planet.

Like many, I was wondering when the official trailer preview for this upcoming project was going to come out. Thankfully, it‚Äôs here and it looks to be a wild ride. I did find Sonic the Hedgehog 2 to be a great time and was superior to the original film, providing plenty of new context, characters, and fan service into the mix that definitely worked for some fun popcorn flick. Sonic 3 seems to continue that trend with the trailer showcasing plenty of new footage from this sequel feature. The return of Carrey‚Äôs Robotnik is definitely worth the wait, and I‚Äôm stoked to see him back and funnier than ever. Plus, the first appearance of Shadow the Hedgehog, who is being voiced by Keanu Reeves, looks to be a great character foil for Schwartzman‚Äôs Sonic and Elba‚Äôs Knuckles. All in all, I‚Äôm quite excited to see what this third installment in this film series has to offer and what a great way to bring the holiday season a celebratory end with a penultimate release like this.
47def2db-de13-46a4-9ab7-b1b654e0c8be.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Official Trailer

Check off the list below so you don‚Äôt forget a thing! 

Pre-K checklist

Establish a consistent bedtime, and start practicing your nighttime routine before the summer ends.
Get a bedtime chart based on your child‚Äôs age in this Parent‚Äôs Guide to Preschool, Part 4.
Read with your child daily to help them build literacy skills.
Explore proven tips for reading with your child in this Parent‚Äôs Guide to Preschool, Part 2.
To get them excited about reading, click through our library of leveled books featuring colorful illustrations and audio narration.
Use this Reading Interest Survey and What I Like to Read worksheet to select books that fit your child‚Äôs preferences.
Help your new student build relationships with their peers.
Discover fundamental social-emotional learning activities for young children in this Parent‚Äôs Guide to Preschool, Part 3).
Make time to develop a connection with your child‚Äôs teacher.
Learn how to forge a positive school-home connection in this Parent‚Äôs Guide to Preschool, Part 1.
Recognize the importance of play, and use educational resources to play with your child at home.
Make home-based learning fun with these hands-on activities, crafts, and memory games!
Help them hone their writing skills before the new school year begins.

Note key physical and cognitive milestones throughout the year.

541b8372-4899-44ca-80fe-9c701b77252b.content:
Venus is the second planet from the Sun, and Earth's closest planetary neighbor. Venus is the third brightest object in the sky after the Sun and Moon. Venus spins slowly in the opposite direction from most planets.

Venus is similar in structure and size to Earth, and is sometimes called Earth's evil twin. Its thick atmosphere traps heat in a runaway greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet in our solar system with surface temperatures hot enough to melt lead. Below the dense, persistent clouds, the surface has volcanoes and deformed mountains.

The ancient Romans could easily see seven bright objects in the sky: the Sun, the Moon, and the five brightest planets: Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. They named the objects after their most important gods.

Venus is named for the ancient Roman goddess of love and beauty, who was known as Aphrodite to the ancient Greeks. Most features on Venus are named for women. It‚Äôs the only planet named after a female god.

Thirty miles up (about 50 kilometers) from the surface of Venus temperatures range from 86 to 158 Fahrenheit (30 to 70 Celsius). This temperature range could accommodate Earthly life, such as ‚Äúextremophile‚Äù microbes. And atmospheric pressure at that height is similar to what we find on Earth‚Äôs surface.

At the tops of Venus‚Äô clouds, whipped around the planet by winds measured as high as 224 mph (360 kph), we find another transformation. Persistent, dark streaks appear. Scientists are so far unable to explain why these streaks remain stubbornly intact, even amid hurricane-force winds. They also have the odd habit of absorbing ultraviolet radiation.

The most likely explanations focus on fine particles, ice crystals, or even a chemical compound called iron chloride. Although it's much less likely, another possibility considered by scientists who study astrobiology is that these streaks could be made up of microbial life, Venus-style. Astrobiologists note that ring-shaped linkages of sulfur atoms, known to exist in Venus‚Äô atmosphere, could provide microbes with a kind of coating that would protect them from sulfuric acid. These handy chemical cloaks would also absorb potentially damaging ultraviolet light and re-radiate it as visible light.

Some of the Russian Venera probes did, indeed, detect particles in Venus‚Äô lower atmosphere about a micron in length ‚Äì roughly the same size as a bacterium on Earth.

None of these findings provide compelling evidence for the existence of life in Venus‚Äô clouds. But the questions they raise, along with Venus‚Äô vanished ocean, its violently volcanic surface, and its hellish history, make a compelling case for missions to investigate our temperamental sister planet. There is much, it would seem, that she can teach us.
541b8372-4899-44ca-80fe-9c701b77252b.title: Venus is the second planet from the Sun, and the sixth largest planet. It‚Äôs the hottest planet in our solar system.

5eeea984-1b04-4c2a-a04e-0180c07bf8bb.content:
An app onboarding can be seen as a funnel full of steps toward the key action of your application. A user installs your app, enters an explanatory onboarding, and starts using the app with the knowledge gained. Each step in the funnel is vital for ensuring the user knows how to use the app, but each step is also a potential drop-off moment. Visualizing and optimizing these individual steps is essential to increase in-app conversions.

What many need to remember is that the onboarding funnel starts outside of the app. The first moment a user sees your app is the first step of the funnel, followed by an App Store page and the actual in-app onboarding. Secondly, it‚Äôs essential to know your app‚Äôs key action that leads to the most user satisfaction or paid conversions. Depending on your funnel optimization goal, this key action will help you track the performance. In this article, I‚Äôll share learnings from the ‚ÄúMarketing and Audience Growth‚Äù course module found at going-indie.com.

Defining your app‚Äôs key action and result
Your app likely contains many features, some more important than others. When optimizing your app, you will set a conversion goal you want to improve. A typical example is to focus on in-app conversions toward a paid subscription.

Using analytics, you can define which actions lead to an in-app conversion. From those actions, there will likely be one or more that lead to a paid conversion the most. For example, my developer tool RocketSim often leads to a paid conversion when the user inspects network traffic using the Xcode Simulator. In this example, the key action would be inspecting network traffic, and the key result is a conversion to a paid subscription.
5eeea984-1b04-4c2a-a04e-0180c07bf8bb.title: App onboarding funnel optimization to increase conversions

The hunt for prey begins as Sony Pictures Sony Pictures (in association with Marvel) release the second official trailer for the upcoming superhero film Kraven the Hunter. View trailer below.

Kraven the Hunter is the visceral, action-packed origin story of how and why one of Marvel‚Äôs most iconic villains came to be. Aaron Taylor-Johnson plays Kraven, a man whose complex relationship with his ruthless father, Nikolai Kravinoff (Russell Crowe), starts him down a path of vengeance with brutal consequences, motivating him to become not only the greatest hunter in the world, but also one of its most feared.

It‚Äôs been sometime since we last heard about this particular movie, especially with the writers / actor strike happening last summer and this movie was pulled from its intended theatrical release and delayed an entire year. So, finally, with all that said and done, the movie is now set to be released this year. This new trailer showcases plenty of new footage from the upcoming film and looks like to be a ‚Äúbloody‚Äù and ‚Äúvisceral‚Äù film of action and thrills. This movie might even break the weak reception that Sony‚Äôs Spider-Man Universe has been plagued since its start. Let‚Äôs hope that it does and that this film proves to be quite effective.

b20dde38-368f-4482-a813-ebae60b93444.content:
Another year older, another year wiser. Today (August 13th) is my birthday (Hooray!) and I wanted to share it with you‚Ä¶.my fellow bloggers and readers.

Yes, I am 39 years old today and (yes‚Ä¶) I‚Äôm officially getting older, but I am still enjoying my life and happy of the life I‚Äôve lived thus far. It‚Äôs also hard to believe that several years ago (I think it was seven or eight or maybe nine) I took a leap of faith and signed up (on WordPress) for my first movie blog‚Ä¶. Jason‚Äôs Movie Blog. I was always scared that no one would read my post / reviews and my passion to create a movie blog would diminish. However, that‚Äôs always been my biggest fears. Just like any artist or person who creates content, I always feared that no one would read my work and that my thoughts / viewpoints would never mean anything, especially since they are plenty of movie blogs out there on the internet. Thankfully, those fearful thoughts have been held back (or at least kept at bay) as my blog has flourished (over the years) and gets many hits each day from around the world.

But that wouldn‚Äôt mean anything if I don‚Äôt have readers, which is where you guys come in. From the bottom of heart, I just wanted to say thank you to all you guys out there. You guys read my work, like my posts, and offered your opinions on them in my comments section. I‚Äôve grown on my social media (I do plan to expand on them and would like some help and advice on grown on their), so thanks to my followers on the various social media outlets as well as the WordPress community to my other fellow bloggers on here‚Ä¶.

As with every year that passes by, I see all the various new movie blogs and bloggers come and go, with some been around for quit some time and I have enjoyed reading / commenting on their posts on some of their reviews. I‚Äôve also seeing some of the bloggers abandoned their blogs and have moved on‚Ä¶.whether they moved to a different platform, life has gotten in the way of things, or simply loss the passion; all of which are completely valid and understandable. There is no denying that sometimes it has been a struggle to keep Jason‚Äôs Movie Blog up and running, especially (several times) falling behind on my reviews due to situations that happen in my life. Yet, blogging has always helped me cope with many different things, making me a better person for it, and to instill my overall love of movies into my review posts. For that, I am eternal grateful to share my thoughts and opinions of cinematic storytelling (whether good or bad) and for all of you for reading them.

In a few weeks I will be going to my family‚Äôs villa in Costa Rica and looking to get plenty of rest and relaxation for two weeks, able to recharge my life batteries, and (of course) playing catch up on some of my movie reviews.

Lastly, I just renewed my plan with WordPress account. That means that Jason‚Äôs Movie Blog is up and running for another year!!! Again, thanks for following me and reading my work.

Sincerely‚Ä¶your fellow movie lover / blogger

Jason of Jason‚Äôs Movie Blog

b5c532ce-278e-4be3-8294-b09bc99f3e78.content:
And the manner was everything. Even though it took a penalty shootout for Leverkusen to lift the fifth major trophy of the club‚Äôs 120-year history (and the third in the last four months under Xabi Alonso), the way in which Die Werkself got there suggested that we are probably not looking at a one-hit wonder. They played all but the first 37 minutes against Stuttgart with 10 men at the BayArena ‚Äì debutant Martin Terrier was sent off for an ill-considered, studs-up lunge ‚Äì and trailed midway through the second half when Deniz Undav gave the visitors the lead with his first touch.

Yet there was no hint of panic, no launching it in the mixer. Leverkusen passed their way around their opponents looking for an opening, even with time running out, until Schick coolly sidefooted in after a dazzling move with little more than a minute to go in normal time. It was another Leverkusen late show (after so many last-gasp goals against Bayern Munich, Borussia Dortmund, Hoffenheim, Qarabag, Leipzig, Stuttgart, is it even a surprise now?) with the Czech striker as so often the man on the spot.
b5c532ce-278e-4be3-8294-b09bc99f3e78.title: Leverkusen the Bundesliga team to beat despite Bayern‚Äôs summer spree

f8f99f37-0fde-4050-a406-0ee9339c7742.content:
NASA‚Äôs Earth Science Division (ESD) missions help us to understand our planet‚Äôs interconnected systems, from a global scale down to minute processes.

ESD delivers the technology, expertise, global observations, and applications that help us map the myriad connections between our planet‚Äôs vital processes and the climate effects of ongoing natural and human-caused changes.

Using observations from satellites, instruments on the International Space Station, airplanes, balloons, ships and on land, ESD researchers collect data about the science of our planet‚Äôs atmospheric motion and composition; land cover, land use and vegetation; ocean currents, temperatures and upper-ocean life; and ice on land and sea. These data sets, which cover even the most remote areas of Earth, are freely and openly available to anyone.

ESD offers end-to-end development, launch, data collection, analysis, and application of its missions, including those with partners in U.S. and international government, and the private sector. ESD also sponsors research and extends science and technology education to learners of all ages, inspiring the next generation of explorers.

Science Questions
NASA‚Äôs Science Mission Directorate Strategic Plan reflects the agency‚Äôs science agenda, as proscribed by the Executive and Legislative branches. Published every four years, the SMD plan is designed to complement the agency‚Äôs overall strategic plan and is informed by the most recent Decadal Survey.

NASA‚Äôs strategic objective for Earth science is to advance knowledge of Earth as a system in order to meet the challenges of environmental change and to improve life on our planet.

The Earth Science Division (ESD) programs address this objective by asking the following key science questions:

How is the global Earth system changing?
What causes these changes in the Earth system?
How will the Earth system change in the future?
How can Earth system science provide societal benefit?
f8f99f37-0fde-4050-a406-0ee9339c7742.title: NASA Earth Science For our research community
